page.title: 01East Loftus and Easington
page.content: Area is from North Road Loftus Noreasterly to Boulby Mines, South to Easington then westerly to loftus. Land coverge cereals, potatoes, turnips, oil seed rape, Grazing, cattle and sheep. Field boundaries of stonewalls, fences and hedges of hawthorn and bramble. Population Easington 1,450. Elevation 450-500ft. Winds mainly strong from sea and SW. Wild Life little owls, ducks, swallows, robins, rooks, starlings gulls, sparrows and bats. Hares, foxes stoats and occasional deer. a few orchids, heather, thristles, Scabuis and cowslip with members of the pea and mint family. Many grasses but few broadleaved trees. A couple of isolated ponds. A174 road is centrally situed in the block. Public footpaths are well used
